pros: Mission-centered and Patient-centered care. An environment that feels like working with family. Close knit-community feel in our work units. Sense of loyalty.
cons: Appreciate that workload intensity is being addressed. This is a sign senior management is listening! Kudos!!

job_title: Nurse Tech in Altamonte Springs, FL
pros: Friendly coworkers. A great place to learn and garner experience before moving on
cons: Understaffed and overworked. Conservative environment. Close minded dress code

job_title: Business Development Manager in Orange City, FL
pros: Some of the best benefits here at Fish is that it is a true family! They care about your growth, happiness, and about their patients.
cons: The only downside I see is that we are working on becoming more synced with the other campuses within AH.

job_title: Director in Orange City, FL

job_title: Registered Nurse in Orange City, FL
pros: The company overall treats their employees well.
cons: Too focused on metrics, not enough focus on what nurses need to do their jobs properly. Health insurance is expensive.

review_title: Great in the beginning then new administration...
job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Orange City, FL
pros: Sufficient training and new employee orientation. Team environment. Overall, positive working atmosphere-- especially interdepartmental. Good pay for Volusia County. Company also offers retirement/benefits.
cons: Limited growth potential. Hiring and salary freeze was implemented to decrease budgetary constraints. This often left the departments lacking for equipment and supplies. Administration went through many changes and a lot of employees sought out greener pastures or were let go to decrease overall company expense.

review_title: Treated well by middle management, but upper management "out of touch"
job_title: Injured and Out the Door Within About A Year in Orange City, FL
pros: Staff and middle management fair, you will find team work, especially on Med-surg between nurses most of the time.  Pay is decent.
cons: Upper management " out to lunch when it comes to day to day functioning as a staff member"  The plastic smiles are really frustrating to staff.  Many benefits have been reduced or completely dropped.

job_title: Management in Orange City, FL
pros: Benefits that's about it at Fish some great friendships built.
cons: Some high lv leadership says the mission well but doesn't live it. Many employees are working poor and or overworked l. COO and other leaders are over paid for the hospital. Compares their highly skilled staff nurses and doctors equal to that of the Walmart across the street. Places felons and unqualified staff in security and engineering.  COO was caught saying that employees or community can die in the parking lots just as long as it's not in the building. Only able to grow at the company if you dont share any opinions that goes against what the leadership thinks. Any talks about unions to help repent employees will find yourself looking for another job. Adventhealth is against unions at all cost in the area.

job_title: Supervisor in Orange City, FL
pros: Some, but not all, great reasons to work here are the benefits,  flexible schedules,  proximity to home,  and fun activities (there's usually something every or every other month).
cons: The most honest con I can describe about working here is "seeing" how many local residents are working-class poor; yet instill,  many of them have and share kindness, even in their sickness.

review_title: Looking to increase your skill set? This is the place for you....
job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Orange City, FL
pros:
Always get your days off
Management is very open 
Able to grow your advanced skill set (intubations, arterial lines, balloon pump, ultrasound use for line placement (IVs, Arterial Lines, Midlines, PICC lines), can work in cath lab, can administer conscious sedation, etc.)
Fast paced (makes the days go by quicker)
cons: In comparison to other places I've worked this is by far the best place. It is like no other.

job_title: Management in Orange City, FL
pros: Administration supports dept functions and defends against physician abuse to nursing staff.
cons: The hospital is comprised of numerous "cliques".  If you are not in the "in" crowd, you will never succeed.  HR is not comprised of people who will assist employees in trouble.

review_title: Not a bad place to work.
job_title: Clinical in Orange City, FL
pros: Nice facilities and up to date equipment. Had in house training and ability to update certifications without having to go elsewhere.
cons: More concerned with customer service than employees. Needed to have the classes for certifications / recertification more often or let more people in the classes at one time. Had to go on my days off sometimes.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Orange City, FL
pros: The people I work with...I know they always have my back!  Leadership genuinely cares about what the front line thinks and continuously asks for ideas and solutions to issues.
cons: Need more patient care techs. Also need to provide more training for new nurses. They are a great addition to the team, but it can be overwhelming when you're new.

job_title: Chief Operating Officer in Orange City, FL
pros: The entire team is amazing with a heart for serving patients and fellow team members. The Fish Family environment is what differentiates Fish from all other organizations.
cons: Remaining focused on caring out loud so patients understand why we do what we do and doing this Always is key for our patient satisfaction.

job_title: Laboratory Manager in Orange City, FL
pros: Adventhealth Fish Memorial is an amazing hospital to work for.  You are cared for like family. There is always a strive to improve services to the community. Patient care is the upmost of importance. The Administration team is involved and compassionate.
cons: I cannot think of a con. Thankful for all the opportunities I have had.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Ocala, FL
pros: Great co-workers, flexibility of hours/schedule.
cons: Like all hospitals, taking call and working holidays.

review_title: Great hospital with a strong culture
job_title: Analyst in Orange City, FL
pros: Great culture, growing hospital, adding PCI and OB soon, fun place to work.  Faith based company that values personal balance and employee wellness
cons: Sometimes staffing challenges, occasionally need to switch hospitals for a new job or growth. Occasionally hear that pay isn’t the highest but I haven’t seen that

review_title: Christian Organization Striving to Extend the Healing Ministry of Christ

pros:
CEO genuinely cares for employees well being, career, and a great leader. 
Chaplin are fantastic and empathetic toward patients and employees . 
Employees tend to be friendly and cooperative.
cons: Location is somewhat distant from Orlando

job_title: Senior Chaplain in Orange City, FL
pros: You know you are in a good organization when you look forward to Monday mornings. Working at Fish is exactly that.  We call eachother our "Fish Family", and that is how it feels. The employees emotional and spiritual needs are important, and management puts that as a high priority.
cons: I love working at Fl hospital Fish.

review_title: It's Been a great place to work during COVID
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Orange City, FL
pros: were quick to get PPE, better than my friends at other systems, good communication, and good teamwork. Kept everyone on full pay during COVID...that was amazing
cons: nothing that was their fault...PPE and Testing are hard to get, but they have done their best.

job_title: Nursing Director in Orange City, FL
pros: Engaged frontline team with supportive local and executive leadership. Every worker knows it's all about us living our Mission, and being there for our community.
cons: There will be expanded services and room privatization with our construction project, and this will eliminate the con of "limited" services and semi-private rooms.
